page.title: 08FLORA AND FAUNA
page.content: As our area is rural there is an abundance of flora and fauna. The common trees are oak, ash, sycamore, chestnut and elm. Perhaps the most common is the sycamore. We planted some acorns earlier in the year and we have three flourishing oak trees. Common wild flowers are daisies, buttercups, dandelions, violets, ladies smock, bluebells, wood anemone and cow parsley is beginning to grow in profusion. As there is little or no air pollution plants and trees appear to flourish in our area. We have a wide selection of birds. There are several rookeries in the area, each with a large population of crows. We also have thrushes, blackbirds(a young family of these are in our school shelter) robins, bullfinches,sparrows, blue tits, pigeons and pheasants.
